results.title: Call to protect English football players from racism
results.brief_description: Following England’s defeat by Italy during a penalty shoot-out in the European soccer championship, black players from the English team who missed their shots were bombarded with racist abuse on social media – from English fans. Fans and supporters like @_etherealtruth responded with a plea to protect the players and black Britons – who will continue to feel the effects of the racist backlash – asking “Only British when it suits you, right?”
results.title_for_label: Call to protect English football players from racism
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Following England’s defeat by Italy during a penalty shoot-out in the European soccer championship, black players from the English team who missed their shots were bombarded with racist abuse on social media – from English fans. Supporters like @_etherealtruth responded with a plea to protect the players and black Britons – who will continue to feel the effects of the racist backlash – asking “Only British when it suits you, right?”

Throughout the tournament, the English football team ‘took the knee’ at the beginning of matches to highlight racial discrimination, injustice and inequality, a gesture that originated with former American footballer and civil rights activist Colin Kaepernick, who in 2016 knelt during the national anthem to protest police brutality and racial inequality in the United States. Considering the anti-racist gesture the team made during the tournament, for players Jadon Sancho, Marcus Rashford and Bukayo Saka to be targeted by trolls left many across the country deeply disappointed, with condemnation coming swiftly from Prime Minister Boris Johnston, Prince William and England’s governing football association, as well as activists, fans and supporters.
description_for_label:
This responsive display presents the moments capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Following England’s defeat by Italy during a penalty shoot-out in the European soccer championship, black players from the English team who missed their shots were bombarded with racist abuse on social media – from English fans. Supporters like @_etherealtruth responded with a plea to protect the players and black Britons – who will continue to feel the effects of the racist backlash – asking “Only British when it suits you, right?”

results.title: Eye of fire
results.brief_description: A gas leak in an underwater pipeline caused an oceanic fireball dubbed ‘The Eye of Fire’ in the Gulf of Mexico. The state owned company is investigating the causes.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

results.title_for_label: ‘Eye of fire’ in the Gulf of Mexico
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

In horrific scenes that seemed more like footage from an action movie than the real world, the ocean was literally on fire on 3 July 2021 in the Gulf of Mexico. The huge fireball blazing across the sea surface was caused by a gas leak from an underwater pipeline, which social media users dubbed ‘the eye of fire’. The video was shared across the internet as further evidence of the environmental tolls of capitalism and the irresponsibility of fossil fuel companies plundering natural resources and producing unnatural results.
description_for_label:
This responsive display presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

In astonishing scenes, the ocean was literally on fire on 3 July 2021 in the Gulf of Mexico. The fireball blazing across the sea surface, dubbed the ‘eye of fire’ by social media users, was caused by an underwater gas leak from a pipeline. The video spread across the internet as further evidence of fossil fuel companies plundering natural resources and producing unnatural results.

results.title: 9 News Covid-19 press conference
results.brief_description: At a recent NSW Covid-19 press conference, authorities revealed they’d fined two nudists for sunbaking outside in defiance of stay-at-home-orders. While that’s revealed to be contentious (they were inside the border), the fact that the duo needed to be rescued after being startled by a deer and getting lost in a forest brought some light-heartedness to the dour proceedings. The Auslan interpretation of the story also tickled Twitter users.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

At a recent NSW Covid-19 press conference, authorities revealed they’d fined two nudists for sunbaking outside in defiance of stay-at-home orders. While that’s revealed to be contentious (they were inside the designated area), the fact that the duo needed to be rescued after being startled by a deer and getting lost in a forest brought some much-needed light-heartedness to the otherwise dour proceedings.

As ABC producer Justin Stevens’ simple caption of ‘2021’ highlights, we’re living through an unusual and absurd age when these types of things seem the norm. Not to mention the lively Auslan interpretation of ‘sunbathing naked’ and ‘deer’, which was quickly turned into a meme and propelled the virality of the moment across social media.

Aside from being a humorous moment, it also highlighted the importance and highly skilled work of the unnamed interpreter, with one Twitter user commenting, “The woman who managed to do the Auslan today deserves credit.”

As Pedestrian TV reported: “Despite all the anxiety-riddled brouhaha that the global pandemic has beset upon us all, one of the great (and few) shining lights has been the, well, light shining upon the string of Auslan interpreters who have gamely stood next to Premiers and Chief Health Officers and interpreted complex, often rapid-fire information on the fly.”

These live-streamed press conferences also offer the public the opportunity to see the production of media and politics, allowing users to interact with breaking news and opine in real-time on social media, rather than just passively receive announcements from the government.
description_for_label:
This responsive display presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

At a recent NSW Covid-19 press conference, authorities revealed they’d fined two nudists for sunbaking outside in defiance of stay-at-home orders. While that’s now contentious (they were inside the border), the fact that the duo needed to be rescued after being startled by a deer and getting lost in a forest brought some light-heartedness to the dour proceedings. Keep an eye on the Auslan interpretation, which also tickled Twitter users.

results.title: "We need pockets. Please and THANK you"
results.material_description:
Digital screen recording from @the_female_lead’s Instagram.
Song and video by @hebontheweb, inspired by @meri.pocket, produced by @iamfredcox.
results.brief_description: Dedicated to amplifying women’s voices and advocating for female equality, The Female Lead teamed up with Heather Chelan and Fred Cox for ‘We need pockets’. Inspired by teenage activist Taarini Saraf’s @meri_pocket, the collaboration exposes the ridiculous practice of incorporating fake pockets into jeans for aesthetics rather than practical wearability.

results.title: Israeli air raid on building housing international media
results.material_description: screen recording of @AJEnglish’s Twitter Digital screen recording from @AJEnglish's Twitter
results.brief_description: In the sixth consecutive day of hostilities between Israel and Hamas, Israeli airstrikes bombed a 15-storey block in the heart of Gaza that housed private homes and workplaces as well as the offices of media organisations Al Jazeera and the Associated Press. Defending the attack, Israeli officials stated that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell out in the building yet AP executive editor Sally Buzbee has called for an independent inquiry into the strike stating that this attack destroyed the ability for news reporting in the territory vehemently fighting for the world’s right to know. “This is an important story and because of the actions yesterday, the world is going to know less.”
results.title_for_label: Israeli air raid on building housing international media
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

In the sixth consecutive day of attacks between Israeli and Palestinian forces, Israel bombed a 15-storey block in Gaza City claiming that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell in the building. Along with the private homes and workplaces in the building, it housed the offices of media organisations Al Jazeera and the Associated Press who were given advance warning of the bombing. Al Jazeera broadcast live, in real time, footage of their own offices being destroyed which went viral changing the international coverage of the ongoing Israel-Palestine conflict. AP executive editor Sally Buzbee has called for an independent inquiry into the strike, stating “This is an important story and because of the actions yesterday, the world is going to know less.”
description_for_label: In the sixth consecutive day of attacks between Israeli and Palestinian forces, Israel bombed an office building in Gaza City, claiming that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell in the building. Along with private homes and workplaces, the building housed the offices of Al Jazeera and the Associated Press, who were given advance warning of the bombing. Al Jazeera and the AP broadcast live footage of their own offices being destroyed, which went viral and changed the international coverage of the conflict.

results.title: Convicted on all charges
results.brief_description: The murder of George Floyd by a Minneapolis police officer was captured on video and incited waves of protests in the US and around the world. When the jury swiftly and unanimously convicted the officer of all charges, huge crowds gathered to pay their respects to Floyd at the intersection where he took his last breaths. Minnesota’s attorney general, Keith Ellison welcomed the conviction stating, “This verdict reminds us that we must make enduring… enduring systemic, societal change.” Three other officers face trial for aiding and abetting murder and manslaughter. Key to securing the conviction was a video taken by a bystander.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

The murder of George Floyd by a Minneapolis police officer was captured on video and incited waves of protests in the US and around the world. When the jury swiftly and unanimously convicted the officer of all charges, huge crowds gathered to pay their respects to Floyd at the intersection where he took his last breaths. Three other officers face trial for aiding and abetting murder and manslaughter.

results.title: What is happing in #SuezCanal today explained
results.brief_description: On March 23, the sight of a container ship lodged inside the Suez Canal like a car abandoned during a bad parallel park enthralled the world. But the traffic the Ever Given blocked wasn’t insignificant, with hundreds of other vessels barred from delivering supplies and the stock market affected. A catastrophe yes, but one that flooded the internet with hilarious memes, like this one from Zaina Erhaim, which married the logistical absurdity with an equally absurd and iconic scene from Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

On March 23, the Ever Given container ship got stuck in the Suez Canal like a car abandoned during a bad park, causing ships delivering supplies around the world to be blocked. Though a catastrophe, the internet responded with hilarious memes, like this one that married the logistical absurdity with an equally absurd scene from Austin Powers.

results.title: Grace Tame’s address to the National Press Club
results.brief_description: When Australian of the Year Grace Tame, an activist and advocate for survivors of sexual assault, was asked what she thought of Prime Minister Scott Morrison’s response ‘as a father’ to rape allegations made by Brittany Higgins, Tame did not mince her words. Herself a survivor of child sexual abuse and influential in the Let Her Speak Campaign, Tame used the National Press Club address to call on fellow survivors, saying “Share your truth, it is your power. One voice, your voice, and our collective voices can make a difference”.

results.title: Trump supporters minding the velvet ropes
results.material_description: Digital screen recording from C-Span's YouTube channel
results.brief_description: After years of consuming viral misinformation, pro-Trump insurgents stormed the US Capitol building in early 2021, pausing their vandalising and looting only to take selfies, as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet ropes, despite dismissing democracy.

constellations_other.name: Fake news: too little too late
constellations_other.description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society, something that is fast becoming one of the biggest concerns of our age.

results.title_for_label: Screen recording of ‘Trump supporters minding the velvet ropes’
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

For several hours on 6 January 2021, pro-Tromp insurgents occupied and vandalised the US Capitol building to protest his 2020 presidential election defeat. It was the grim climax of Trump’s “Save America” rally, where he incited the mob to “take back our country”. After years of consuming viral misinformation and conspiracy theories, the rioters enthusiastically played out their apocalyptic fantasies, taking pictures and selfies amidst the mayhem as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet guide ropes, despite showing little care for democracy or the five people who died from the event.
description_for_label:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

For several hours on 6 January 2021, pro-Tromp insurgents occupied and vandalised the US Capitol building to protest his 2020 presidential election defeat. It was the grim climax of Trump’s “Save America” rally, where he incited the mob to “take back our country”. After years of consuming viral misinformation and conspiracy theories, the rioters enthusiastically played out their apocalyptic fantasies, taking pictures and selfies amidst the mayhem as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet guide ropes, despite showing little care for democracy or the five people who died from the event.

results.title: If at first you don’t succeed
results.brief_description: Since 2015, Celeste Barber’s resisted the swarm of unattainable images on social media with her #celestechallengeaccepted project, an experiment to see how normal people look recreating the perfectly staged poses of the rich and Insta-famous

constellations_primary.name: If at first you don't succeed
constellations_primary.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Smartphones aren’t a mirror, but the images and videos influencers and celebrities post on social media can seem like standards we should reflect. Australian comedian Celeste Barber isn’t aspiring to these unrealistic ideals. Since 2015, Barber’s resisted the swarm of air-brushed and unattainable images with her #celestechallengeaccepted project, an experiment to see how normal people look recreating the perfectly staged poses of the rich and Insta-famous. Though originally intended as a laugh, Barber’s posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.
description_for_label:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Though originally intended as a laugh, Barber’s posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.
